title: How to study physics for the NEET for 2021 - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello The Physics portion is the hardest of all the sections and needs thorough knowledge of each and every subject. This segment contains 45 questions, with 180 marks, dominated by topics like Electrostatics, Mechanics and Electronics If you think this is the area in which you are not that strong then you need to do it daily. Make notes and study. The best way to score high marks in physics is to study each chapter with complete commitment and twice clear the whole concept. Formulas are Physics 's backbone. The most critical step in preparing NEET Physics is learning the Formulas. So, every day try to understand those formulas. Solve as many mock tests and past years papers as you can. You can refer to these books- 1. Concept of Competition Physics for CBSE PMT by Aggarwal’s 2. NCERT- Physics Part 1 and Part 2 3. Concepts of Physics by H.C. Verma 4. NCERT Physics: CBSE PMT set of 3 Volumes by Anil Aggarwal The secret to your success in physics is practice and practice. You can follow Toppr- the better learning app for more information about NEET preparation. Keep working. Hope this was helpful:) All the best!

For that please refer NCERT first because it is important for the Concepts and basics with that please refer all formula for the preparation Make Formula notes to revise on a daily basis so that you can use those when you are solving examples with that please refer DC PANDEY and HC VERMA for examples Revision is the best to prepare physics for the exam with that try to solve old papers of NEET(particular for physics) You can find all the papers with a solution on TOPPR APPLICATION so that your time can't waste for the solution and you can do more practice on that remaining time Thank you 👍

First get acquainted with differentiation, integration, graphs, log , vectors. Secondly start with basic chapters in mechanics as they form the foundation of subject If possible join a coaching institute so that you can get your doubts clarified and get daily homework for questions’ practice. You can also refer to BM Sharma. It’s got tons of examples for ample practice. Most importantly, practice a lot till you feel awesome and confident while doing the questions .

you can go for NCERT physics of ( both class 11 and 12 ) of for NEET 2021. For theory portion you have to focus mainly on theoretical units like : MODERN PHYSICS , THERMODYNAMICS, RAY AND WAVE OPTICS, SEMICONDUCTOR , ELECTRIC CURRENT, CONDUCTORS, ELECTROMAGNETIC WAVES, you can also read “points to ponder” section of physics NCERT . Fir NUMERICAL portion you have solve maximum to maximum questions. Practice a lot with questions and revise formulas from all the topics alteast once in a month.

First of all understand the concepts clearly from NCERT / HC VERMA and do question solving practice from HC Verma/ DC Pandey or from any book or coaching material . Note how many questions you can solve/attempt in 1 hour try to increase this number to more than 45 and learn from your mistakes . also while practicing we can learn new concepts and how to approach the question.
